com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.frontend.actions

Class OdpSecurityManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.AbstractSecurityManager
      • com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.BusinessLogicActionSecurityManager
        • com.rds_software.customers.menarini.projects.odp.frontend.actions.OdpSecurityManager

  • public class OdpSecurityManager
extends com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.BusinessLogicActionSecurityManager
    Security manager for ODP (Ordine di Pagamento) business logic actions.

    This class controls access to ODP operations based on user roles and document state. It handles two main categories of actions:

    • Management Actions (IManageOdpAction): Create, edit, and update ODPs
    • Approval Actions (IApprovalOdpAction): Review and approve ODPs

    Security Rules

    • Create/New: User role must have creation permissions (RoleType.canCreate())
    • Update: Validated via OdpUtils.isCanBeEdited(Odp, OdpUser) based on document state and ownership
    • Approval: Validated via OdpUtils.isCanBeApproved(Odp, OdpUser) based on workflow state and role
    See Also:
    BusinessLogicActionSecurityManager, OdpUtils, RoleType

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.BusinessLogicApplication appl)
          throws Exception
        Initializes the security manager with the business logic application. Extracts and caches the current OdpUser from the OdpApp.
        Overrides:
        init in class com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.AbstractSecurityManager
        Parameters:
        appl - the business logic application (must be an instance of OdpApp)
        Throws:
        Exception - if initialization fails
        IllegalArgumentException - if appl is null or not an instance of OdpApp
        IllegalStateException - if OdpUser cannot be retrieved

      • isBusinessLogicActionEnabled

        public boolean isBusinessLogicActionEnabled(com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.BusinessLogicAction businessLogicAction)
                                     throws Exception
        Determines whether the specified business logic action is enabled for the current user.

        Security evaluation logic:

        • CreateOdpAction: Requires RoleType.canCreate() permission
        • NewOdpAction: Requires RoleType.canCreate() permission
        • UpdateOdpAction: Uses OdpUtils.isCanBeEdited(Odp, OdpUser) to check edit permissions
        • IApprovalOdpAction: Uses OdpUtils.isCanBeApproved(Odp, OdpUser) to check approval permissions

        Specified by:
        isBusinessLogicActionEnabled in class com.rds_software.businesslogic.xwebapp.BusinessLogicActionSecurityManager
        Parameters:
        businessLogicAction - the action to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if the action is enabled for the current user, false otherwise
        Throws:
        Exception - if the action cannot be evaluated
        IllegalArgumentException - if businessLogicAction is null or the action type is not supported
        IllegalStateException - if odpUser is null (init was not called)
        See Also:
        AbstractSecurityManager.getApplicationInfo()
